intro: Amomum alpinum, commonly known as the Alpine cardamom, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces dark brown, three-lobed fruits that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often grown at high altitudes for its unique flavor profile. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
